instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1286: What is A1286? A1286 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2009 , Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2255, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2330, 820-2532, 820-2523, 820-2533, 820-2850, 820-2915, 820-3330..
definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 512M Samsung 216-810005 replacement solution?with 216-0810001
threads.message:
Hi,
this had been an old topic, but we are out of 216-0810005(6750), and have few 216-0810001 left.(6770)

I had no issue sub-replace the 6750 with 6770 on all 1G VRAM boards. 

but having problem with boards with 512m vram.

Im having two <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board with 512m sumsung VRAM.  replaced the 6750 with 6770, computers boosts fine and log into OS.


but when we click system info the VRAM Size is  like a 8-9 digital numbers:  214873492374m

yes something like that ,and apparently not recognizing the VRAM size. 

and once run photo booth after like 30 seconds would display video issue, like square boxes. but would go away if I close the APP after a while.



so think can be the issue with the info inside the EFI bios IC. is there any way we can modify the info inside and make it to work?
( I know 6750+512m can be a working combination since one IMac machine is using the same thing.but for <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, there is no default original as 6750+512m)

any advice would be appreciated.
thank you

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 512M Samsung 216-810005 replacement solution?with 216-0810001
threads.message: Not gonna work, trust me I tried everything. Install correct GPU.

threads.message:
thanks for the info DUKE. i mean i always want to do that at the first place with  the correct GPU, but just impossible to get.
did you get any news about them?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 512M Samsung 216-810005 replacement solution?with 216-0810001
threads.message: 0001 was available last week when I bought them. Just got to find the "good" Chinese sellers. I got date code 2011 ones, 100% real and no polished up 2016 garbage.
